Success Factor Happiness – An Introduction To Happiness In Business And Economics

The course SUCCESS FACTOR HAPPINES wants to show how happiness can be a core concept in life as well as in all aspects of doing business. Studies showed that it is for the most part in one’s own hands to influence the degree of happiness – and that happy employees are more productive. Tony Hsieh, the CEO of zappos.com, demonstrated that “delivering happiness” to customers creates an immense value, and therefore he was able to sell the company to Amazon for 1 billion US$. Google shows that it cares about happiness by having a CHO (Chief Happiness Officer) supporting its staff. And the king of Bhutan showed that he cares about the happiness of his people by measuring “Gross National Happiness” instead of GDP. This innovative course combines business with happiness concepts as well as positive psychology and puts happiness into the focus of business.

This course aims at introducing the field of European film history and audiovisual (screen) culture, emphasizing the history of film aesthetics and film historiography. A key idea behind the course is that film as an art form, a means of expression and communication should be looked at from a broader social context. This implies the influence of technological, political, sociocultural and economic factors. This course, which is inspired by recent developments in film and cinema studies, focuses on textual film analysis, as well as on issues related to the production and societal reception of films.In an introductory part, the course explains the multiple historical importance of film, with a focus upon different kinds of film history (film as art, as an industry, as a political, cultural and societal phenomenon). This part also deals with the issue of film historiography; here the course critically looks at the main problems and pitfalls of film historiographical practices.In the next part, the course presents some of the major or canonical film schools in Europe, including the period of pre-cinema, early cinema, the international expansion of film before the First World War, the German Weimar cinema, Soviet cinema during the interwar period, French interwar cinema, European cinema during the Second World War, Italian neo-realism and the French New Wave. Where necessary, insights of film theory will be used (e.g., montage theories within soviet cinema, theories in relation to classical and alternative film style).During the lectures, a great number of film excerpts will be shown.

《商务数据分析与应用》是进行科学研究的一项重要工具，也具有很强的应用性，它在自然科学、社会科学和经济管理等各领域中得到了越来越广泛的应用，是一种非常有用的数据处理方法，是商学院管理科学与系统科学专业基础课程。从商学院学生的角度出发，通过深入剖析实际案例，向学生展示了统计学在数据分析这一领域的应用。课程收集了电子商务、金融、医疗管理等行业的案例，案例内容涉及客户管理、产品定价、消费者偏好、渠道营销、组织行为等领域。本课程的教学目的在于让学生熟练掌握多种多元统计方法的基本思想，数学原理的基础上，能够把大量的数据简化到人们能够处理现实问题。能够通过案例的学习，找出现实问题中有待解决的问题，根据问题设计因变量、自变量及初始模型，在分析的过程中逐渐完善统计模型，解释模型的意义，一步一步地向学生展示了数据分析的原理、思想及方法
本课程涵盖了基本统计方法，包括判别分析、聚类分析、主成分分析、相关分析和因子分析、典型相关分析、多元回归分析等各种多元分析方法的思想及统计分析方法，也包括运营优化方法，如DEA分析、AHP分析、线性规划、二层优化方法，同时将上述方法应用于电子商务、供应链管理、健康管理等领域，引导学生学会使用上述方法进行实际案例分析
